alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo, northwestern Cameron and southwestern Willacy Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 321 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tierra Bonita, or over Santa Rosa, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mercedes, La Feria, Progreso, Santa Rosa, Palm Valley, Santa Maria, Primera, Doctor Hesiquio Rodriguez Elementary School and Llano Grande Country Club. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 34 and 37. US Highway 281 between mile markers 806 and 818. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
